summary: This document is an email chain from October 7, 2019, between FBI and SDNY personnel planning victim meetings in the Epstein case. It details the agenda for meetings with victims, the number of victims identified (25 total, with 4 new ones), their geographic origins, and logistical planning for interviews and support.

persons.name: Assistant Special Agent in Charge
persons.role: FBI Assistant Special Agent in Charge, New York Field Office
persons.context: Author of the initial email providing updates on victim meeting logistics, victim counts, and geographic origins of victims.

events.title: Planning for Epstein Victim Meetings
events.description: FBI and SDNY personnel coordinate via email to plan upcoming victim meetings in New York and Miami, discussing agenda, victim attendance, and support resources.

keyFacts: As of October 7, 2019, investigators had identified 25 victims (10 in Miami, 12 in NY) for planned meetings, with 4 new victims recently identified.
Victims were traveling from diverse locations including Tennessee, Ohio, Australia, Louisiana, Washington, Spain, and California.
The meeting agenda included introductions, status updates, safety concerns, victim identification, prosecution process explanation, media engagement, victim's rights, and FBI support resources.
The FBI planned to offer victims the opportunity to be interviewed on the same day or the next day after the meetings.
